main event: A man in Columbus, Ohio observed an unidentified bright, shiny object moving faster than a star, with stationary periods and sudden disappearance to the west on September 8, 1961 around 0130Z.
interesting points: The object was brighter than a star and moved faster than a star.
The object was stationary at times and then suddenly disappeared to the west.
The witness was sitting on his back porch smoking a cigar when he noticed the object in the sky.
The witness estimated the object's speed as 568 mph and its distance as 4-5 minutes of observation.
